newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Acer, China Development in T$1.5 bln joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Acer, China Development in T$1.5 bln joint venture.

text.p: Taiwan's China Development Corp said on Monday it was planning a T$1.5 billion joint venture in integrated-circuit testing and packaging with Taiwan computer giant Acer Inc.
A spokesman for China Development Corp, one of Taiwan's top venture capital and investment firms, said an investment arm of Taiwan's ruling Nationalist Party also was interested in the venture.
"The plan is still in its initial stage and we have not yet worked out details," he said by telephone.
Many analysts predict the semiconductor industry, which has endured a fierce price war in 1996, would recover in 1997.
